subtitle: Education
title: Makers Academy
summary:
A 16-week intensive programming bootcamp, focusing on: 

* Agile methodologies.

* Object-oriented design.

* Test driven development and behaviour driven development.

* Pair programming.

* Production of high quality clean code.

* Emotional intelligence.

projects.name: TraderPV
projects.description: An FX trading app, showcasing users realtime exchange rates & crypto currency prices from around the globe. Detailed graphing of there fluctuation over the last 3 months is also shown.

projects.name: VirusFigures.com
projects.description: A coronavirus dashboard, displaying the latest COVID-19 figures from around the U.K.

projects.name: Small Steps
projects.description: This was my final group project at Makers Academy. Small Steps is a carbon footprint calculator for journeys by car, train, bus or plane throughout the United Kingdom. The project utilizes a React.js front end (first time I had used it), Node.js backend along with googleMatrix and autocomplete Api's.

projects.name: quiknews
projects.description: This project was completed in a weekend and helped me practice Single page web apps and AJAX requests using vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. I approached the game logic using Test Driven Development, Object Oriented principles, and a component based design paradigm for the stories. The app consumes the Guardian's API with an asynchronous request to load in the most recent news stories. When a news story is chosen, it's content is summarised by the Aylien text API and presented to the user in 5 sentences with the associated article photo.

projects.name: MakersBnb
projects.description: A redesigned & better (in my opinion) clone of Air Bnb enabling users to sign up and list/ book spaces.

projects.name: Banking Tech Test
projects.description: A CLI application emulating a bank account, focusing on the production of best practice code, obeying the principles of Object Orientated Design and TDD.

title: University of Bristol
summary:
* MEng Electrical and Electronic Engineering. 

* First Class Honours.

 * Specialised in Communications Engineering.

* Represented the University of Bristol at Rugby between 2015-2019.

projects.name: Rubik's Cube Robot
projects.description: A group design project during my 3rd year at the University of Bristol with the task of designing & building a robot capable of solving a Rubrik's cube. Our design incorporated using Pythons Open CV (Computer Vision Library) along with 6 webcam's to detect the initial setup colors of each square on each of the cubes 6 faces. This information was then relayed to a javascript open source algorithm which would return the moves required to solve the cube, after which 6 servo motors would then implement the moves.

projects.name: Performance Evaluation of OFDM & FBMC Systems in the Underwater Acoustic Channel
projects.description: This thesis examines the performance of OFDM-CP and OFDM-OQAM systems in both horizontally and vertically configured underwater acoustic channels. Each system was designed, built and tested over a period of 7 months using Mathworks MATLAB software package. I achieved first class honours for this research and for final presentation to the Dean of Engineering.

subtitle: Work Experience & Jobs
title: Barclaycard (Internship)
summary:
* I completed a 9 week internship as a Technology Intern within Barclaycard's merchant acquiring business. 

* Responsibilities included: maintaining the high performance of Barclaycard’s payment authorisations platform, reporting of technological risks to senior management along with driving projects to meet their deliverables.

title: Cricket Direct

title: GreenKeeper - Harpenden Common Golf Club
